Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Okay lets tackle this BPMN analysis First I need to understand the process flow as described The user provided a pseudo-BPMN diagram so I should break it down step by step Starting with the Start Event which is the beginning of the process The first task is Receive Customer Request Task A Then theres an XOR gateway to check the request type That makes sense because the process branches based on whether the request is standard or custom

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: If its standard they go to Task B1 Perform Standard Validation Then theres an AND gateway for parallel checks So Credit Check C1 and Inventory Check C2 happen at the same time After both are done they join and move to Task D Calculate Delivery Date

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: If the request is custom it goes to Task B2 Perform Custom Feasibility Analysis Then another XOR gateway checks if customization is feasible If yes they go to Task E1 Prepare Quotation If no send rejection notice and end

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: After either the standard or custom paths theres an XOR gateway to check if approval is needed If yes they go to Task F Obtain Manager Approval Then another XOR to see if approval is granted If yes generate invoice Task G If not re-evaluate conditions and loop back to either E1 custom or D standard If no approval needed directly go to generate invoice Then Task I Send Confirmation to Customer followed by End Event

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now I need to explain each steps purpose the gateways convergence looping and differences between standard and custom paths Also conditions for approvals and rework For standard vs custom the validation steps differ Standard has parallel checks custom has feasibility analysis The approval process is after both paths but if approval is denied they loop back to the relevant task I need to make sure I clarify that the loop back is conditional Also the final steps after invoice generation are sending confirmation regardless of the path

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: First the gateways XOR means exclusive choice so only one path is taken AND gateway splits into parallel paths that must all complete before proceeding The loop back from H to E1 or D depends on the previous path I should structure the explanation by first outlining the overall process then each steps purpose gateways convergence and then the differences between the two paths Also when approvals are needed and how rework is triggered Maybe use bullet points for clarity but since the user wants a detailed explanation it should be thorough but organized
